children.name: open
Example - subscribe to the "open" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "open" event during initialization

children.description: Fires when the calendar is opened

children.name: close
Example - subscribe to the "close" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "close" event during initialization

children.description: Fires when the calendar is closed

children.name: change
Example - subscribe to the "change" event after initialization
Example - subscribe to the "change" event during initialization

children.description: Fires when the selected date is changed

children.name: value
Example - sets the value of the widget
Example - gets the value of the widget

children.description: Gets/Sets the value of the DatePicker.

children.name: setOptions
children.description: Changes the initial DatePicker configuration.

children.name: open
children.description: Opens the calendar.

children.name: min
Example - set the min value of the DatePicker
Example - get the min value of the DatePicker

children.description: Gets/Sets the min value of the DatePicker.

children.name: max
Example - set the max value of the DatePicker
Example - get the max value of the DatePicker

children.description: Gets/Sets the max value of the DatePicker.

children.name: readonly

parameters.name: readonly `Boolean`
parameters.description: The argument, which defines whether the DatePicker should be readonly or editable.

children.description: Toggles the readonly state of the widget. When the widget is readonly it doesn't allow user input.> There is a difference between disabled and readonly mode. The value of a disabled widget is **not** posted as part of a `form` whereas the value of a readonly widget is posted.

children.name: enable

parameters.name: enable `Boolean`
parameters.description: The argument, which defines whether to enable/disable the DatePicker.

children.description: Enable/Disable the DatePicker widget.

children.name: destroy
children.description: Prepares the **DatePicker** for safe removal from DOM. Detaches all event handlers and removes jQuery.data attributes to avoid memory leaks. Calls destroy method of any child Kendo widgets.> **Important:** This method does not remove the DatePicker element from DOM.

children.name: close
children.description: Closes the calendar.

children.name: Example - get options of the widget
value
children.description: Specifies the selected date.

children.name: start
Example - specify the initial view, which calendar renders

children.description: Specifies the start view.The following settings are available for the **start** value:

children.name: parseFormats
children.description: Specifies a list of date formats used to parse the value set with `value()` method or by direct user input. If not set the value of the format will be used. Note that the `format` option is always used during parsing. > The order of the provided parse formats is important and it should go from more strict to less strict.

children.name: month.empty
Example - add date value to the out-of-range cells
Example - specify an empty cell template as a string

children.description: The template used for rendering cells in the "month" view, which are outside the min/max range.

children.name: month.content
Example - specify cell template as a string

children.description: The template to be used for rendering the cells in "month" view, which are between the min/max range.

children.name: month
children.description: Templates for the cells rendered in the calendar "month" view.

children.name: min
children.description: Specifies the minimum date that the calendar can show.

children.name: max
children.description: Specifies the maximum date, which the calendar can show.

children.name: format
Example - specify a custom date format

children.description: Specifies the format, which is used to format the value of the DatePicker displayed in the input. The format also will be used to parse the input.

children.name: footer
Example - specify footer template as a string
Example - specify footer template as a function

children.description: The [template](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-template) which renders the footer of the calendar. If false, the footer will not be rendered.

children.name: disableDates
Example - use a function to disabled dates
Example - specify an array of dates to be disabled
Example - specify an array of days to be disabled

children.description: An array or function that will be used to determine which dates to be disabled for selection by the widget.

children.name: depth
Example - set navigation depth of the calendar popup

children.description: Specifies the navigation depth. The followingsettings are available for the **depth** value:

children.name: dates
Example - specify a list of dates

children.description: Specifies a list of dates, which will be passed to the [month template](#configuration-month.content).

children.name: culture
children.description: Specifies the culture info used by the widget.

children.name: ARIATemplate
children.description: Specifies a template used to populate value of the aria-label attribute.

children.name: animation.open.duration
children.description: The duration of the open animation in milliseconds.

children.name: animation.open.effects
children.description: The effect(s) to use when playing the open animation. Multiple effects should be separated with a space.[Complete list of available animations](/api/javascript/effects/common)

children.name: animation.open
children.description: The animation played when the calendar popup is opened.

children.name: animation.close.duration
children.description: The duration of the close animation in milliseconds.

children.name: animation.close.effects
children.description: The effect(s) to use when playing the close animation. Multiple effects should be separated with a space.[Complete list of available animations](/api/javascript/effects/common)

children.name: animation.close
children.description: The animation played when the calendar popup is closed.

children.name: animation
Example - disable open and close animations

children.description: Configures the opening and closing animations of the calendar popup. Setting the `animation` option to `false` will disable the opening and closing animations. As a result the calendar popup will open and close instantly.
